cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 115 mi SSW of Negril, Jamaica and 210 mi SE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the northwest Caribbean, forecast to cross western Cuba Friday, then accelerate north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Mississippi) this weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near Plaquemines Parish

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning currently limited to Cayman Islands and western Cuba – none yet along the U.S. Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch_coast – no U.S. coastal warnings with this advisory.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas/Louisiana border eastward to Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle, with highest threat over southeast Louisiana.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (>=34 kt) have a 58 % cumulative chance; hurricane-force winds (>=64 kt) reach 10 %. Peak onset probability for TS winds is 37 % in roughly 72 h (Sunday).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Dangerous storm surge potentially exceeding 3–5 ft possible along Plaquemines Parish coastline, especially east of the center at landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: Very heavy rainfall exceeding 6 inches possible Sunday–Monday, producing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, large waves, possible tornadoes in outer rain bands, and prolonged port access restrictions.
